meanings.sent1: The ziz of the bees filled the garden with a lively hum.
meanings.sent2: I heard a ziz as the fly zoomed past my ear.
meanings.sent3: The ziz of the mosquito was like a tiny orchestra playing in my room.
meanings.sent4: The ziz of the electric saw cut through the silence of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The ziz of the spinning top was music to the child's ears.

meanings.sent1: The cheetah can ziz across the savannah in pursuit of its prey.
meanings.sent2: I need to ziz through my chores before dinner time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to ziz up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to ziz by as we raced to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The skateboarder can ziz down the ramp with incredible speed.

meanings.definition: A feeling of excitement or energy.
meanings.sent1: The ziz of anticipation before opening a gift is thrilling.
meanings.sent2: Her performance on stage was full of ziz and enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The ziz of the crowd at the concert was contagious.
meanings.sent4: There was a ziz in the air as the team prepared for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The ziz of the party was evident in the laughter and dancing.
